intro: Palicourea lugoana, commonly known as Brazilian starfruit, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns yellow when mature. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests.
